definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: Someone hefted the register back up to its place on the counter.
sentences.chinese: 有人拿起收银机，把它放回柜台原来的位置上。

sentences.english: A cashier can store cash register values pnly for himself for the day.
sentences.chinese: 收银员只能存储当天自己使用的收银机值。

sentences.english: Sally rang up Eve's purchase of tomatoes…
sentences.chinese: 萨利已把伊夫买的西红柿记入收银机。

sentences.english: The first place it goes is into the Barn's cash register.
sentences.chinese: 第一站是巴恩汉堡店的现金收银机。

sentences.english: John told him there was a telephone by the cash register.
sentences.chinese: 约翰告诉他收银机旁有电话。

sentences.english: Suggest additional items, but don't put obstacles before the cash register.
sentences.chinese: 建议增列项目，但不要把面前的障碍收银机。

definition: (at a restaurant) to order a meal/(of a waiter) to take an order
variant of 櫃檯|柜台[gui4 tai2]
sales counter/front desk/bar/(of markets, medicines etc) OTC (over-the-counter)
variant of 櫃檯|柜台[gui4 tai2]
counter for the display of goods/(Tw) container (for freight transport)
to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結帳|结帐
